author: terencechain
content: Hi <@199561711278227457> ,  what tools are used to generate genesis states for test nets? We are wondering if we're at a point now that we can delete "start from deposits" code and just always assume a genesis state in the db. This would open up a lot of cleanup opportunities.

author: parithosh
content:
I'm mainly using proto's `eth2-testnet-genesis` tool ( https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-testnet-genesis). I just tested lighthouse with its `merge` state and it worked flawlessly, so it recognized the validators and didn't need to start deposit processing. I guess you're talking about prysm using the same approach?

command used to generate the merge state:
`eth2-testnet-genesis --config config.yaml --mnemonics menmonics.yaml --eth1-config genesis.json --tranches-dir /output --state-output /output`

tagging <@892053833121923094> in case the change affects hive
